H0.text: Air is the best conductor of heat at room temperature.

H1.text: Water is the best conductor of heat at room temperature.

H2.text: Sulfur is the best conductor of heat at room temperature.

H3.text: Copper is the best conductor of heat at room temperature.

A4.text: Silver conducted heat far the best of all other metals, next to this was copper

A5.text: In the absence of convection, air and other gases are good insulators

A6.text: Copper has high thermal conductivity, second highest (second only to silver) among pure metals at room temperature.
